<div  class=" cl-item-data cl-item-data-level-2"><div  class=" cl-item-avatar"><a  href="/user/home/ninsigma"><img  src="http://s2.n4g.com/usersav/313490-1_0.jpg"/></a></div><div  class=" cl-item-content"><a  href="/user/home/ninsigma"  class=" cl-item-username">ninsigma</a><span  class=" cl-item-time">80d ago </span><p  class=" cl-item-text">It&#39;s certainly an impressive looking game, I&#39;m in now way trying to say it looks bad. I just feel there are better looking games already this gen. Though I do give huge kudos for how good it looks in such a big environment. <div  class=" cl-item-data cl-item-data-level-2"><div  class=" cl-item-avatar"><a  href="/user/home/px54"><img  src="http://s2.n4g.com/defaults/avatar_placeholder.jpg"/></a></div><div  class=" cl-item-content"><a  href="/user/home/px54"  class=" cl-item-username">PX54</a><span  class=" cl-item-time">79d ago </span><p  class=" cl-item-text">Considering it&#39;s a 1:1 scale replica of that section of New York, I&#39;m happy with the graphics.  Plus &#39;poor graphics&#39; isn&#39;t something that will prevent me from playing something.  <br /> I can&#39;t understand why some people only want something to look good, rather than play good.  If something only looks good, you get a photo or a movie. If something only plays well you&#39;ve still got a game. </p><div  class=" cl-item-meta"><a  href="#"  class=" meta-agree" It isn&#39;t a high end PC so you have to give it some wiggle room (not 1080/60 both with Ultra textures and blah, blah, blah).  <br />   <br /> It is one of the better looking console games actually and is multiplayer on top of that. <div id="c-11073566" class="cl-item ">

<div  class=" cl-item-data cl-item-data-level-2"><div  class=" cl-item-avatar"><a  href="/user/home/px54"><img  src="http://s2.n4g.com/defaults/avatar_placeholder.jpg"/></a></div><div  class=" cl-item-content"><a  href="/user/home/px54"  class=" cl-item-username">PX54</a><span  class=" cl-item-time">79d ago </span><p  class=" cl-item-text">I couldn&#39;t change to my pistol - no matter how quickly or how long I held down the button - just kept swapping between the two other weapons.  <br />   <br /> That was really the only downside I experienced - only played for about an hour or so. <div  class=" cl-item-data cl-item-data-level-2"><div  class=" cl-item-avatar"><a  href="/user/home/pipermcfierceson"><img  src="http://s2.n4g.com/usersav/206807-1_0.jpg"/></a></div><div  class=" cl-item-content"><a  href="/user/home/pipermcfierceson"  class=" cl-item-username">PiperMCFierceson</a><span  class=" cl-item-time">79d ago </span><p  class=" cl-item-text">@ocelot07 just dont act like it was some perfect game. <div id="c-11071640" class="cl-item ">

<div  class=" cl-item-data cl-item-data-level-0"><div  class=" cl-item-avatar"><a  href="/user/home/ninsigma"><img  src="http://s2.n4g.com/usersav/313490-1_0.jpg"/></a></div><div  class=" cl-item-content"><span  class=" cl-item-bubble-pointer"><span></span></span><a  href="/user/home/ninsigma"  class=" cl-item-username">ninsigma</a><span  class=" cl-item-time">80d ago </span><p  class=" cl-item-text">I don&#39;t understand what this is:  <br /> &quot;Disabled the option to transfer Dark Zone brackets as a Rogue (This prevents players using Bracket Transfer as a means to             <div class="cl-replies-more-context">
                <div class="cl-replies-more-panel">

<div id="c-11072780" class="cl-item ">

<div  class=" cl-item-data cl-item-data-level-1"><div  class=" cl-item-avatar"><a  href="/user/home/wellyuk"><img  src="http://s2.n4g.com/usersav/559920-1_0.jpg"/></a></div><div  class=" cl-item-content"><a  href="/user/home/wellyuk"  class=" cl-item-username">WellyUK</a><span  class=" cl-item-time">79d ago </span><p  class=" cl-item-text">Because it&#39;s what makes the game interesting, everything else about this game is poor. The DZ is the best part of the game because it&#39;s got risk reward system at play which makes player interaction interesting and different compared to most games on consoles. Forces people to play differently and doesn&#39;t spoon feed you like most games, you have to actually learn the game to succeed. </p><div  class=" cl-item-meta"><a  href="#"  class=" <div id="c-11083143" class="cl-item ">

<div  class=" cl-item-data cl-item-data-level-1"><div  class=" cl-item-avatar"><a  href="/user/home/brokenbracket"><img  src="http://s2.n4g.com/usersav/23412-11_0.jpg"/></a></div><div  class=" cl-item-content"><a  href="/user/home/brokenbracket"  class=" cl-item-username">brokenbracket</a><span  class=" cl-item-time">75d ago </span><p  class=" cl-item-text">The fact that they&#39;re listening to the gamers is a good thing. <div  class=" cl-item-data cl-item-data-level-0"><div  class=" cl-item-avatar"><a  href="/user/home/braveheart_nz"><img  src="http://s2.n4g.com/defaults/avatar_placeholder.jpg"/></a></div><div  class=" cl-item-content"><span  class=" cl-item-bubble-pointer"><span></span></span><a  href="/user/home/braveheart_nz"  class=" cl-item-username">Braveheart_NZ</a><span  class=" cl-item-time">79d ago </span><p  class=" cl-item-text">We turned off Ambient Occlusion and put sharpness up to 70 in the game and the blur went away and the game actually looked really good as in crisp and clear. Objects in the distance looked clearer to. It depends on what you like but to us here it looked much better.. With it turned on things looked a bit grainy and muddy to my eyes. Its not like destiny where when you become lv40 and if you do a strike its lv12. <script>
    var waitFor$ = setInterval(function () {
        if (typeof (jQuery) == "undefined") {
            return;
        }
        clearInterval(waitFor$);
        $(document).ready(function () {
            if (location.hash.indexOf("#comment-") != -1) {
                $('.cl-comments-more-button').click();
                $('.cl-replies-more-button').click();
                setTimeout(function () {
                    var id = parseInt(location.hash.replace("#comment-", ""));
                    $("html, body").animate({ scrollTop: $('#c-' + id).offset().top }, 300);
                    location.hash = "";
                }, 100);
            }
        });
    }, 10);
</script>
